header: Fix the spellchecker for non-US residents
idea_text: I live in Australia. As much as I love the US, I am not from the US and I do not use American English. header: App Launcher functionality
idea_text: I logged into my O365 instance this morning to see that my App Launcher had changed. It was odd because the O365 main page had been updated to have the Gallery look, however, the App Launcher still had the classic white on gray tiled look.  I didn't realize that at some point the App Launcher would get the Gallery look too.  Now, all of the icons we did for our tiles for our apps which were white (light gray) to match that classic style...are basically invisible.  Okay, fine, we can live with recreating icons to use with the new look...however, I also find that the simple functionality of being able to rearrange the icons is now lost, the resize is lost and the ability to unpin MS apps is also lost.  Isn't it enough that the main O365 page doesn't give you the ability to better manage the icons there...that now you had to go and remove that functionality from the App Launcher.  LOL...like, that couldn't have been a designer's idea...that must have been marketing's idea or something..."Let's not let them unpin any MS apps from the App Launcher...and relegate their app tiles to the bottom.".  Alright, so, to try to be at least somewhat constructive here...let me restart with these ideas.  1)  The ability to pin and unpin ANY of the app tiles in the App Launcher.  2) The ability to drag and drop the app "tiles" so that I can re-arrange them how I want them.

header: Let users control CONTRAST of themes
idea_text: The inability to change the CONTRAST of the screen makes this a very negative experience. I appreciate that the white space/gray space is meant to be "light" but some people with vision challenges need to be able to see darker shading - in mail, for instance, it's like looking at a blindingly white screen with light gray text. I would like the ability to select a theme that gives more contrast -- darker text, darker gray, but keep white, white. I can't just adjust the brightness of the screen because it doesn't change the CONTRAST of the screen elements. I'm not angry, just using all caps to emphasize the issue -- it's not that I want all dark colors, its a CONTRAST issue. And, BTW, I am a UX/UI specialist... Thanks for letting me provide my experience feedback.
